title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Language Project Design: Efficient Learning Through Explicit Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Learners must systematically acquire language structures unfamiliar biologically or culturally, while collaborating on projects in a limited digital environment (primarily smartphone-based).

learning_goals: Learners can develop language education materials through a three-stage project design process applying cognitive load theory
Establish instructional strategies that reduce learners' working memory load by 30% using step-by-step activities (whole-part-whole) based on explicit teaching methods
Complete a language learning project with optimized cognitive load using smartphone-based collaboration tools (Google Docs, Padlet, etc.) in a PBL environment

resources: Offline worksheet template for language learning
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
